meanings.definition: A flowing together of two or more streams.
meanings.sent1: The confluence of the rivers created a larger body of water.
meanings.sent2: The confluence of ideas from different team members led to a successful project.
meanings.sent3: At the confluence of the two rivers, the fish seemed to have a party.
meanings.sent4: The confluence of cultures in the city made it a vibrant and diverse place.
meanings.sent5: The confluence of colors in the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful hue.

meanings.definition: A coming or flowing together, meeting, or gathering at one point.
meanings.sent1: The confluence of people at the event made it lively and exciting.
meanings.sent2: The confluence of interests among the group members helped them find common ground.
meanings.sent3: The confluence of flavors in the dish surprised and delighted the taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The confluence of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The confluence of voices in the choir created a harmonious melody.
